Narrative report

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. The annual report also provides valuable data on the financial situation of the project. Based on an analysis of the project performance in relation to the project output(s) and expected outcome(s), a revision of the project work plan may be suggested by the project partners. The consequences of a possible revision on the project work plan and budget must be made clear in the annual report. Nuffic monitors outputs and outcomes and not activities. Therefore, the main focus of the annual report must be on the achievement of the project’s output(s) and planned outcome(s). The information provided in the annual reports of the projects is used by Nuffic to monitor the progress of the project and to inform the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other stakeholders about the output(s) and outcome(s) being achieved by individual projects and the Orange Knowledge programme as a whole. Please note that if project progress is in accordance with the original planning, reporting requirements are minimal. Only in case of deviations from the planning, more elaboration is demanded. In the Grant Obligations and Conditions, the obligatory dates for submission of the annual/additional reports are mentioned. The final report must reflect on the entire project period.

title.narrative: 14. Final report TMT+/TMT

description.narrative:
Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period.
+
In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

title.narrative: 2. Project progress and achievement

description.narrative:
In this section (maximum 1000 words), please
**For TMT+:**
Comment to what extent the outputs have been achieved. Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

actual.value: Not applicable for the period 2020. Final report will be submitted in 2022.

title.narrative: 2. Project progress and achievement

description.narrative:
In this section (maximum 1000 words), please
**For TMT+:**
Comment to what extent the outputs have been achieved. Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

actual.value:
**Preparation** **June - August**
- Finetuning objectives and approach - Strategy sessions with JAEA - Criteria - recruiting - selecting app. Master Trainers - First planning
**Needs analysis** September 2020 7 online workshops
- Introduction sessions 1 session - Needs analysis & priority setting via online surveys, polls, questions, introductions: - Hydroponic 2 sessions - IPM 1 session - Value Chain Management 2 sessions - Labour market needs analysis vocational graduates 1 session
​
_**Program activities Master Trainers Private sector**_
**Didactical skills for all Master Trainers** October 2020 2 workshops
- Training development - training skills - 2 workshops - Master Trainers
​
**Hydroponic training for the selected hydroponic trainers (7 participants)**
- **November - December:** Hydroponic for Master Trainers: 6 Workshops for Master Trainers Master Trainers - Hydroponic** coaching sessions** - identification main learnings and conversion lessons learned into practical advice for farmers) 2 workshops for selected Master Trainers Hydroponic
**Introduction sessions IPM for selected IPM trainers (7 participants)**
**Introduction session Value Chain management trainers (5 participants, we lost unfortunately one participant due to Covid-19**
​
_**Program activities Teachers of the vocational schools**_
**November - December 2020**
- Introduction session - results labor market needs - priority setting - Competence Based learning & Soft skills 6 Workshops
**Overall, more than 26 online sessions are conducted with the participants in the period September - December 2020**.
**Coordination: At least bi-weekly, but most times weekly; coordination sessions** are organized to evaluate the progress, the learnings, commitment, planning, trainers, content etc.

comment.narrative: 26-01-2022: Not applicable (no scholarships)

title.narrative: B.I.4. % of scholarships awarded to women

comment.narrative: 26-01-2022: Not applicable

title.narrative: B.I.1. Number of scholarship holders / TMT participants that have successfully completed course/training (male / female / minorities)

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: 18 Master trainers/experts, working for private sector companies or the Jordan Agricultural Engineering’s Association, who will develop and implement training for mainly (mid-level) farmers. 11 Male and 7 Female experts. Approximately 7 teachers of vocational institutes. Initially, the project selected 5 teachers of a male school and 5 teachers of a female school. Unfortunately, there is a lack of attendance of the male teachers. 1 Official of the government, department vocational education (male) who attended the teacher's program.
- 12 teachers (6 male; 6 female) - 24 persons from AEA are trained

title.narrative: B.O.1. Number of organisations strengthened by individual and/or group training

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: 6 Public organization: Master Trainers and Teachers from 2 Vocational schools, 2 Universities Ministry, Research Center 7 Private companies: Master Trainers working for private institutes or branch organizations.

title.narrative: B.O.2. % of alumni / TMT participants who have applied the acquired knowledge and skills within their working environment

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: After a long time of preparation - staff selection - making agreements - needs analysis - expertise analysis, planning and finally the preparation of training scripts and material we started in November with the first (online) training. It's too early for applying knowledge and skills in their working environment. Only a few hydroponic trainers could apply some tips in their own farm.

title.narrative: B.I.2. % scholarship holder's /TMT participants / alumni satisfaction

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: In 2020 biweekly verbal evaluations are done to finetune the subjects, level of expertise, and knowledge and to finetune the planning and evaluate trainers. An official satisfaction evaluation is not done. The main critical comment, comes from the (male) teachers: they value the content as very positive, appreciate very much the subjects, but they want to be rewarded for attending these courses by the Jordan Government.

title.narrative: B.I.8. % alumni / TMT participants who state that they have acquired new knowledge and skills; e.g. problem solving, effective communication

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: Regular (biweekly) verbal evaluations and direct communication between project coordinators - trainees and trainers assure that the subjects are relevant and new.

FNS.2 Promote agricultural growth
FNS.2.2. Number of family farms (sub-sector, male/female, age: % < 35) with improved access to input and/or output markets

comment.narrative: >20000 private agricultural engineers are involved in AEA - Each year 2015 -2108 more than 4000 people gained training at AEA. For the next years AEA expect that each year 1200 family farms, trainees will benefit from the training

28-12-2021: We started with several Train the Trainers sessions, all online due to Covid. We expect that these trainers can start the first training for farmers from September 2021 onwards. Improved access to output markets is just a small part of our program. Improved access to input is not part of our program.
2 teams \* 2 trainings per team \* 10 participants per training \* 50% result

title.narrative: FNS.2.1. Number of family farms (sub-sector, male/female, age: % < 35) with increased productivity and/or income

comment.narrative: 28-12-2021: We started with the training of trainers / future experts in the subjects Hydroponic, IPM, and Value Chain management. Due to Covid all sessions online, so we could not train the trainers in the field. In the period of September 2021 and onwards, we plan that trainers start with the training of farmers.
6 trainer teams \* 2 trainings per team \* 8 participants/ training \* 50% result

FNS.2.2. Number of family farms (sub-sector, male/female, age: % < 35) with improved access to input and/or output markets

28-12-2021: In 2020 biweekly verbal evaluations are done to finetune the subjects, level of expertise, and knowledge and to finetune the planning and evaluate trainers. An official satisfaction evaluation is not done.
The main critical comment, comes from the (male) teachers: they value the content as very positive, appreciate very much the subjects, but they want to be rewarded for attending these courses by the Jordan Government.

title.narrative: B.I.11. Improved gender equality and gender awareness in the workplace

actual.value: In the selection of Master Trainers and vocational schools we paid special attention to a balanced team of male - female participation. For linkage education with industry special attention is paid to 'recruit' female role models from the industry. During the workshop with the industry (in July 2021), special attention is paid to the importance of women participation for economic, ecologic and social benefits of the sector.

title.narrative: B.I.10. Changes in personal, academic and professional attitudes and attributes through training and education programmes
